messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: In the last two centuries, technology and health have improved, so fewer children died when they were young. This caused the population to grow very quickly. These large families had more children who grew up and then had their own families.

However, things changed in the 1960s when it became easier to get contraception, which are methods used to prevent pregnancy. Because of this, the global average number of babies for each woman has gone down from six to only two.
Feedback received: Grade 1/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: The submission is an instant FAIL due to a CEFR level mismatch. The target level was B1, but the output was classified as A2. This is a non-negotiable failure condition as per the Stage 1 protocol.

messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level B1

Text saved: In the last two centuries, improvements in technology and health meant that fewer children died young, which caused rapid population growth because these large families had more children who survived into adulthood.

However, this changed in the 1960s when contraception, which are methods used to prevent pregnancy, became more widely available, causing the global average number of babies per woman to fall from six to only two.
Feedback received: Grade 4/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text: The submission fails the Preliminary Metrics Check. The text was classified as B2 level, which does not match the target B1 level. This is primarily due to the use of complex sentence structures, such as the non-defining relative clause ('which are methods...') and the participial clause ('causing the global average...'), which are characteristic of B2 proficiency.
